etymologies: mid 17th century: from react+ -ion, originally suggested by medieval Latin reactio(n-), from react- ‘done again’ (see react)

definitions: an action performed or a feeling experienced in response to a situation or event

examples.text: Carrie's immediate reaction was one of relief

shortDefinitions: action performed or feeling experienced in response to situation or event

definitions: a person's ability to respond physically and mentally to external stimuli

examples.text: a skilled driver with quick reactions

shortDefinitions: person's ability to respond physically and mentally to external stimuli

definitions: an adverse physiological response to a substance that has been breathed in, ingested, or touched

examples.text: such allergic reactions as hay fever and asthma

shortDefinitions: adverse physiological response to substance that has been breathed in or touched

definitions: a chemical process in which two or more substances act mutually on each other and are changed into different substances, or one substance changes into two or more other substances.
shortDefinitions: chemical process in which two or more substances act mutually on each other and are changed into different substances

definitions: an analogous transformation of atomic nuclei or other particles.
a mode of thinking or behaving that is deliberately different from previous modes of thought and behavior

examples.text: the work of these painters was a reaction against fauvism

shortDefinitions: mode of thinking or behaving that is deliberately different from previous modes of thought and behavior

definitions: opposition to political or social progress or reform

examples.text: the institution is under threat from the forces of reaction

shortDefinitions: opposition to political or social progress

definitions: repulsion or resistance exerted in opposition to the impact or pressure of another body; a force equal and opposite to the force giving rise to it.
shortDefinitions: repulsion or resistance exerted in opposition to impact
